name: Ethiopia
description: Ethiopia, the birthplace of coffee and one of Africa's oldest civilizations, is a land of dramatic landscapes, ancient cultures, and remarkable biodiversity.  From the towering Simien Mountains to the vast Ethiopian Rift Valley, the country offers a diverse range of experiences.  Its rich history is evident in its numerous historical sites, including Aksum, Lalibela, and Gonder, while its vibrant culture is reflected in its music, dance, and cuisine.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Ethiopia is Africa's second-most populous country.
quickFacts.detail: The population is largely concentrated in rural areas, with a growing urban population.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Ethiopia covers a vast area of the Horn of Africa.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Eritrea, Sudan, Kenya, South Sudan, and Djibouti.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city is a hub for regional diplomacy.
quickFacts.detail: Addis Ababa is located at an elevation of approximately 8,000 feet.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Amharic is the language of government and commerce.
quickFacts.detail: Oromo, Tigrinya, and Somali are also widely spoken.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Birr is the official currency of Ethiopia.
quickFacts.detail: It's pegged to the US dollar.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Agriculture remains a significant contributor to the GDP.

climateData.title: Climate of Ethiopia
climateData.description: Ethiopia experiences a diverse range of climates due to its varied topography. Generally, it's a hot, dry country, but variations occur across regions. The Rift Valley creates a unique microclimate, while the highlands are cooler and wetter.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is the most common season, characterized by low rainfall and high temperatures. It's ideal for visiting the highlands and exploring historical sites.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Rainy Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The rainy season brings significant rainfall, particularly in the southwest. While it can make travel more challenging in some areas, it's crucial for agriculture and the landscape is lush and green.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Cool Season (December - January)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures drop significantly in the highlands during this period, offering a pleasant climate for hiking and exploring.

naturalWonders.name: Simien Mountains National Park
naturalWonders.description: The Simien Mountains are a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for their dramatic landscapes, unique wildlife, and stunning biodiversity.  They offer unparalleled hiking opportunities and breathtaking views.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to the Gelada baboon, Walia ibex, and Ethiopian wolf, among other species. The jagged peaks and deep valleys create a truly spectacular environment.

naturalWonders.name: Danakil Depression
naturalWonders.description: The Danakil Depression is one of the hottest and lowest places on Earth, a surreal and otherworldly landscape of volcanic activity, salt flats, and hot springs.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The depression is a geological marvel, shaped by volcanic eruptions and tectonic activity. It's a challenging but rewarding destination for adventurous travelers.

naturalWonders.name: Blue Nile Falls
naturalWonders.description: The Blue Nile Falls, also known as Tisisi, are a spectacular cascade of the Blue Nile River plunging into a deep gorge. They are a powerful and awe-inspiring sight.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The falls are a significant source of the Nile River and a symbol of Ethiopia's natural beauty. The surrounding area offers opportunities for wildlife viewing and cultural exploration.

ecosystemData.title: Ethiopian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Ethiopia boasts a diverse range of ecosystems, including afro-alpine forests, grasslands, wetlands, and drylands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, many of which are endemic to the region.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Ethiopia is home to a remarkable diversity of mammals, including the Ethiopian wolf, Gelada baboon, Walia ibex, and African wild dog.

statistics.details: Many species are found nowhere else on Earth.
A significant number of large mammal species inhabit the country.

notableSpecies.name: Ethiopian Wolf
notableSpecies.significance: The rarest canid in the world.

notableSpecies.name: Walia Ibex
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered wild goat species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Ethiopia is a birdwatcher's paradise, with over 800 bird species recorded, including numerous endemic and migratory species.

statistics.details: A high proportion of bird species are endemic to Ethiopia.
The country is a crucial stopover for migratory birds.

activities.title: Activities in Ethiopia
activities.description: Ethiopia offers a wide range of activities for travelers of all interests, from hiking and wildlife viewing to cultural immersion and adventure sports.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Ethiopia is a hiker's dream, with trails ranging from gentle walks to challenging multi-day treks.

activities.name: Simien Mountains Trek
activities.description: A challenging but rewarding trek through the stunning Simien Mountains, offering incredible wildlife viewing opportunities.
activities.requirements: Good fitness level, hiking boots, warm clothing

activities.name: Danakil Depression Trek
activities.description: An adventurous trek through the surreal landscapes of the Danakil Depression, experiencing volcanic activity and extreme heat.
activities.requirements: High fitness level, heat-resistant clothing, water supply

activityCategories.name: Cultural Tourism
activityCategories.description: Immerse yourself in Ethiopia's rich history and culture by visiting ancient sites, attending festivals, and interacting with local communities.

activities.name: Visit Lalibela
activities.description: Explore the remarkable rock-hewn churches of Lalibela, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

activities.name: Attend a Traditional Ethiopian Wedding
activities.description: Experience the vibrant traditions of an Ethiopian wedding, with music, dance, and elaborate ceremonies.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves
